name: Girolamo Savonarola
summary: Girolamo Savonarola was a Dominican friar who led a moral and religious reform movement in Florence from 1494 to 1498. He criticized the corruption of the Church and the Medici family, calling for repentance and reform. His influence led to the 'Bonfire of the Vanities' where luxury items were burned. However, he was eventually excommunicated, tried for heresy, and executed by hanging and burning.
keyQuotes: The Church must be reformed, and it will be reformed.
